sections.title: Intro & Context Setting
sections.goal: Establish the interviewee’s role in Phoenix Feature Store and surface the core technical and business objectives.
sample_questions: Can you describe your role and responsibilities in the Phoenix Feature Store project?
What are the primary goals for the feature store in its Build phase?
How does your MLOps work align with Novereon’s mission and values?

sections.title: Architecture & Pipelines
sections.goal: Explore the technical design of online/offline feature serving and how drift monitoring is integrated.
sample_questions: Can you walk me through the current architecture for online and offline feature serving?
How do you ensure consistency between the online and offline stores?
What does your drift monitoring pipeline look like, and how is it triggered?

sections.title: Integration with Other Systems
sections.goal: Understand how Phoenix Feature Store interacts with other projects like Helios Datalake or Nimbus Observability.
sample_questions: Are there direct data feeds from Helios Datalake into Phoenix? How are they validated?
What telemetry or observability data from Nimbus is used in drift detection?
How do you handle schema evolution when upstream systems like Borealis ETL change?

sections.title: CI/CD & Model Deployment
sections.goal: Discuss the processes and tooling for model CI/CD using Phoenix as a backbone.
sample_questions: What CI/CD pipelines are in place for feature transformations?
How do you manage versioning of features and ensure backward compatibility?
Can you give an example of a rollback procedure, perhaps referencing RB-FS-034?

sections.title: Performance, SLAs & Risk Management
sections.goal: Dive into performance targets, SLAs, and strategies to mitigate risks such as feature drift or data outages.
sample_questions: What are the key SLOs or SLAs you track for Phoenix?
How do you mitigate the risk of feature drift impacting model performance?
Can you walk me through a recent incident or decision that balanced performance against risk?

sections.title: Future Outlook & Continuous Improvement
sections.goal: Explore how the system will evolve and how lessons learned feed back into design and operations.
sample_questions: What enhancements are planned for the Phoenix Feature Store in the next phase?
How do you capture and prioritize improvement ideas from incidents or retrospectives?
If you could redesign one part of the current architecture, what would it be and why?
